website_summaries.verdict: Long dirt bike ramp at 10 feet that makes it easy to roll the bike up a shallow angle.
pros: Folds down to a size of 60 by 11.25 inches, so it can be stored anywhere
Good width so you don't feel like you might roll off the edge if you slip
Uses serrated crossbars that give the bike's wheels some traction while you're loading it
Weighs 22 pounds, which isn't bad for a large ramp
cons: Only provides support for up to 600 pounds of weight, which is low for a large ramp

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to load a couple of lighter sport bikes into my truck. I've just used it for the one so far, but it worked well. Anchor strap only comes with one hook so I mad a a slip knot in the other end to anchor it. For reference I drive a '14 F150 Supercab with max towing/payload options on it so the back end sit's a little higher than normal. With an extra set of hands to balance the bike it went flawlessly. Best part is when it's folded up it's small enough to fit in the backseat floorboard so it doesn't slide around in the back of the truck with the bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Racheltech

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Ramps!
customer_reviews.text: These ramps are fantastic. I've used them to load my Triumph 675 into the back of my F150 numerous times now. They fit within the cab of my Super Cap truck and aren't as crazy heavy as the 4 rung wide version are I had before. ITs only good up to 600lbs per ramp though so i have to be careful to limit who helps me push up the ramp if she's not running. You can see footage of me loading with these ramps in multiple videos on my youtube channel under Triumph Babe.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Driggs

customer_reviews.title: ... for loading a motorcycle into a truck bed is amazing. Still folds to fit into the bed like ...
customer_reviews.text: The extra length for loading a motorcycle into a truck bed is amazing. Still folds to fit into the bed like any other ramp. Seriously, buy this longer ramp!!! 7ft ramps are just making the task harder than it needs to be.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Deeg

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and light weight. 1500 lbs. per ramp, all I need to easily load my ATV's into my trailer. Wide enough to feel safe, long enough to take any hard pitch away depending on terrain. And they easily fold in half as a space saving measure. In addition they come with safety straps to secure the ramps preventing kick out when loading. Fits my criteria and the price was reasonable. They will be used for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Long enough and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Super light weight...this is a big selling point for me. Easily handles me, 175 LBS, and my 600 LBS Track-barrow. The 10' length allows me to load it in a truck bed that is chest height.
customer_reviews.author: JP Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Seems sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy enough for a large dirt bike. Full size touring Harley would be pushing it but that's not what this is made for. I just bought one to load a 250 pound dirt bike. It's wide enough to keep a bike on the track. I appreciate how long it is as to flattening out the loading angle. And it folds in half, making it convenient to carry in the bed of my truck. Made of super light aluminum, and mine came with two straps to anchor it to my tow hitch so my bike doesn't go kicking it out from under me as I power it up the ramp. Exactly what I'd hope for.
customer_reviews.author: Gize

customer_reviews.title: They are light enough to handle easily. The welds and workmanship look good
customer_reviews.text: I got my ramps in two days. They are light enough to handle easily. The welds and workmanship look good. I loaded and unloaded my sidecar bike by myself with these ramps. Just to be safe, I put a support under the hinge of the ramp carrying the heavy side of the sidecar. I put the bike in the U-haul truck with a cable puller and I rode it off. The ramps were very stable.
customer_reviews.author: NW

customer_reviews.title: A lot of flex, digs into tailgate.
customer_reviews.text: They work well for loading my KTM two stroke. Because of how much these ramps flex when there is any weight on them they will dig into whatever you have them mounted on. It would be beneficial to cover that portion of the bed or tailgate with something to prevent damage.
customer_reviews.author: John J.

customer_reviews.title: so you need to get some good ones to secure the ramp to your vehicle so ...
customer_reviews.text: The straps included are junk, so you need to get some good ones to secure the ramp to your vehicle so it wont slip. Also, they should be a few inches wider because the front and back wheels of ATV's are not always in alignment. The wheel spread can be different. Given the con's, they are light and they do work, but backing down them is a scary proposition.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky Patriot

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was quick, box came a little damaged so was a little worried at first. Had a few scratches but at the end of the day it's going to get scratched up anyways. Works with my Honda atv and blaster but those are light. Has flex to it and would be a little cautions of large 4x4 atvs. Definitely not for UTVs.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime L MacElroy

customer_reviews.title: Super flexy, I tried to run a 600 lb ...
customer_reviews.text: Super flexy, I tried to run a 600 lb tractor up these into the bed of a 2018 truck and they were too flexy. These would probably work great for any lower bed trucks but higher ones are a bit too sketchy for me
customer_reviews.author: Salad

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome, my truck is lifted and the standard ramps are useless for my truck, these have the right amount of lift that makes loading and unloading easy. Motorcycles and atvs. They do now but no problem.
customer_reviews.author: sam7759

customer_reviews.title: These are great! My truck has a 4" lift so I ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great ! My truck has a 4" lift so I needed ramps that were longer than most. These work well but I have found it necessary to put some sort of support in the middle to make them a little more stable. I use a set of jack stands for that !
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Carrico

customer_reviews.title: I have a stock height Silverado. Them seem to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a stock height Silverado. Them seem to want to walk on the tailgate, even when they are strapped to to hitch. Walking up them on foot gives me an uneasy feeling. Overall I am not impressed, loading a 400 lb motorcycle was very unstable and the ramps flexed a lot. They also came scratched up, hardware was barely tightened. There is cotter pins through the bolts, but hardware was very loose.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: They flex quite a bit!
customer_reviews.text: Like all the other reviews, the most noticeable thing is the amount of flex. I think they are more than adequate for your average 400 lb. quad. They survived the unloading of a 600+ lb. buggy. I bought these for my son-in-law to load & unload my grandsons 50 cc & 90 CC quads. He should be OK. I got for myself the Titan wide 9 foot ramps - way superior and more versatile!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff F.

customer_reviews.title: Great ramp 👍
customer_reviews.text: I am 6 foot tall and push a 250 and 450 dirt bikes up this ramp effortlessly. It is almost double then length of a traditional single ramp making the angle of the ramp much easier to push a bike up. Folds in half to fit nicely in the back of the truck and it also comes with a strap that you can use to secure the ramp to your hitch when you're using the ramp to load into a pickup. Price is slightly high but worth it. You get for what you pay for. Great ramp.
customer_reviews.author: john moseley

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for loading my GSXR 750 in the bed of my Tacoma. It’s has a small lift on it so it sits a little higher than stock. It works like a charm and having the longer ramp length of 10ft makes it super easy if I have to load or unload on my own. I’ll definitely buy this again or just to have two in the chance that I buy an ATV.
customer_reviews.author: Kyler G

customer_reviews.title: The ramps arrived intact, and the length was exactly ...
customer_reviews.text: The ramps arrived intact, and the length was exactly what we needed since our Ford 350 stands HIGH on 19-1/2" wheels. The only drawback was that the first time we used them, one of them promptly collapsed at the center joint. We rigged up a bracing system to hold it steady so we could use it. That's kind of a pain in the neck, but they work when we need to use them. Now we're careful, however, about the weight of any of our equipment that we might need to load.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Joosten

customer_reviews.title: i recommend this one for
customer_reviews.text: works awesomely. does exactly what it needs to do. having a ramp that has an arch is a lifesaver for those of us with a little taller truck bed. i recommend this one for sure
customer_reviews.author: kelso

customer_reviews.title: Good ramps.
customer_reviews.text: Work as advertised. My F250 is tall so I needed long ramps. These worked great. I had to rig the security straps a little differently but now it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS L WATERS

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality
customer_reviews.text: if you have a lifted truck it is a tad bit short (2016 F150 5 in lift 35 in tires)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are easy for me to maneuver and place on the stairs
customer_reviews.text: These are easy for me to maneuver and place on the stairs. I can now move the mower up the stairs to mow in the front yard without hurting my back.
customer_reviews.author: ADTRESCUE

customer_reviews.title: It is long (that's what she said).
customer_reviews.text: It is long (that's what she said). Will make pushing or riding my motorcycles into the back of my lifted truck much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Voyer

customer_reviews.title: Great Ramp
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of them -- one for my motorcycle and one for me to walk up while loading the bike in my pickup. My bike weighs over 400 lbs and one of the ramps supported it, and me, without any problem. The additional length of the ramps makes loading a lot easier. The enclosed safety straps were easy to figure out. I like the light weight, too. The operating instructions could use a rewrite, they're a little confusing. Overall, an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Alan R. Buehler

customer_reviews.title: Great For Lifted Trucks
customer_reviews.text: Plenty long enough to load my RZR 800, 50" wide in my 2012 lifted Dodge running 37's. Comes with a strap to keep it hooked up. Great shipping to Denver area. Very Happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve C

customer_reviews.title: This is the ramp you want for motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this ramp folds down nice and compact, very light, all the welds and joints appear to made with a high attention to detail, and they coating is tough and looks great. 10’ ramp is definitely handy when riding a dirtbike into a lifted pickup. Highly recommend to anybody
customer_reviews.author: Sammie B =|=

customer_reviews.title: Great ramps
customer_reviews.text: Perfect length for use with a lifted truck and the arch adds peace of mind and a sense of stability while loading an atv
customer_reviews.author: Mopar johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfully light ramps use to load atv in back of my 3500hd im 460lbs plus my machine ,ramps seem very solid my only complaint was the paint was peeling and missing in a few spots upon delivery.
customer_reviews.author: NorthernPawz

customer_reviews.title: cant beat the price
customer_reviews.text: works well for the price. use it to get 2 scooters in and out of a raised house. about a 2.5 or 3 foot incline and don't scrape the exhaust header on it at all on a relatively low scooter (Honda ruckus that's stretched)
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: These are terrific and well worth it. very safe loading ATV onto 4x4 dodge Ram. Some flex but I doubt they would ever break for their intended use. My atv is 800 lbs., I am 240 lbs
customer_reviews.author: sky

customer_reviews.title: A must for taller pickup trucks so you can safely load!
customer_reviews.text: They work perfect! Love how light they are, yes they will flex but that isn’t a flaw.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I used these ramps to load 2 ATVS sideways in my truck. I am about 190 pounds and have a honda rancher 350 and honda foreman 450. I drove each of them up and the ramp bowed at joints. Needs to be more secure when loading. Came intact and fast shipping. Directions state they are not responsible for anything you load if it breaks the ramp. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Works very well they are a little wobbly but once you get past that very good product
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Set the ramp properly before using and watch your fingers from pinching.
customer_reviews.text: Everything about it met my expectations. The extra length makes the angle of the ramp less when you can,t find a small incline to park on to lessen the upward angle of the ramp.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Bill McAlister

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ramps for a lifted truck!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Ram 1500 with a 6 inch lift and big mud tires which puts it high off the ground. Having these ramps definitely help with getting my quad in the back!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Light weight ramps that are strong and durable! Worth the price! Easy to hook up!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product lightweight and strong perfect for a taller truck ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product lightweight and strong perfect for a taller truck my golf cart goes right into the back of my 2015 f250 now

customer_reviews.title: Nice ramps
customer_reviews.text: Very to easy to fold and use. Only issue is that the safety latches were not compatible with our truck so we made latches out of other straps

customer_reviews.title: Worth the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: For a few dollars more than the lightweight model, this one is superior. Safety first as my dad would say. This is a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J

customer_reviews.title: Great ramps!
customer_reviews.text: These are great...a friend has the wider version, but due to the weight I chose the narrower ones. They're awesome for loading my mower into my pickup & into the trailer I use as as shed! Much safer than the ATV ramps I was previously usine!
customer_reviews.author: Nuzee61

customer_reviews.title: ... side even without the straps they are relatively light easy open and fold for
customer_reviews.text: They look strong tried them today over the steps at the building i work i walked over together with my snow blower they did not move an inch slide down ot to the side even without the straps they are relatively light easy open and fold for storage
customer_reviews.author: Xhevat Kabashi

customer_reviews.title: Not very good my golf cart says its 935lbs and a 200 ...
customer_reviews.text: Not very good my golf cart says its 935lbs and a 200 lb driver and this is what happened after two uses

customer_reviews.title: Best price
customer_reviews.text: Between the free shipping and their low price I saved nearly $90 on the exact same ramps. These ramps are well built and just what I needed to load my kids utv in the back of my truck. I couldn't be happier.

customer_reviews.title: This ramp works great, Use it for dirt bikes and together with ...

customer_reviews.title: works well, used with triton atv168 trailer and 4 ...

customer_reviews.title: Solid ramp for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great ramp for a lifted truck. I use it on a f250.

customer_reviews.title: Great ramps.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The ramps performed as advertised. They were shipped on time and delivered earlier than promised. Will definitely do business with Titan again.

customer_reviews.title: I love it. It makes loading my dirt bikes in ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It makes loading my dirt bikes in my truck easy. I didn't want to buy a ramp smaller than 10 ft.

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight strong ramps
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set of fairly strong foldable ramps. Lightweight. Easy to use. Works perfect for my use
customer_reviews.author: John Jakob

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for slightly lifted full size trucks
customer_reviews.text: Great product Didn’t notice too much flex when loading either the LTZ400 or the 660R The arched designed doesn’t allow for storage under the quad. But fits nicely along side the quad on top of the wheel well.
customer_reviews.author: BarDog

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Likes: works, light weight, black, simple design, comes with pull strap Dislikes: not great strap but ok.
customer_reviews.author: Alex T.

customer_reviews.title: Buy these
customer_reviews.text: Though I grossly over estimated the ramp length I needed I am very pleased with these ramps. Very light weight and sturdy. Fast shipping and great value

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Work just fine on my dodge 2500, which sits pretty high.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Was exactly as described. Makes for easy unloading. Liked it so much (price, quality, and shipping) I ordered another one the day after I got my first!

customer_reviews.title: Excellent service!
customer_reviews.text: This seller delivered my ramps before the expected date, which was. My husband uses these for his landscaping equipment. Everything has been excellent so far.

customer_reviews.title: Solid. Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4" lift on my truck and this ramp allows me to self load my dirt bike. Awesome.

customer_reviews.text: I use the ramp to load a lawnmower into the back or a breadtruck (almost 4 feet off the ground). They don't seem sturdy but so far they have not failed me.

customer_reviews.title: Ramps
customer_reviews.text: They do work for us. Plenty strong and easy to set up.

customer_reviews.title: Way too much flex
customer_reviews.text: Ramps flexed way too much just walking up them. Not sure a 600lb per ramp rating is accurate. No way would I try and load an atv with these ramps.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect for loading my golf cart. Very well built and light weight. Highly recommend!!

customer_reviews.title: Legit!
customer_reviews.text: Ramp is heavy duty and legit! The length is amazing for my 12” lifted Duramax. (Yes, I needed a 10’ ramp.) Recommended! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Fires perfectly in the bed of the truck. Well built and long enough for my tall truck. I would buy them again if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Seven

customer_reviews.title: Kick A$$ Ramps!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect length for my 32" bed. Awesome for any bike. One ramp can be positioned to load bike and the second used to walk up the ramp next to the bike with bike powered up using clutch. A steal at $209!!!! Couldn't build em' for that. A+
customer_reviews.author: Proviews

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: The ramp arrived very quickly in perfect condition, and works very well for loading my dirtbike on the truck by myself. The slightly longer ramp makes pushing the bike up the ramp much easier than the shorter ramps.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy & well built. Worked great & safely getting my 4 wheeler off of my flat bed truck.

customer_reviews.title: They look great!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the ramps yet but they look great and the ramps look sturdy too. If anything changes once I use them for my 2002 Yamaha Banshee then I'll be sure to let you know.

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our situation
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our situation. The custom box on our Search and Rescue response vehicle has a pull out drawer under the deck where an ATV lives. The extra length makes loading and unloading much safer. The folding feature allows the ramps to be stored side-by-side on the deck, under the ATV. Thanks for the very prompt delivery.

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend these ramps to my friends
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend these ramps to my friends. The only reason I'm not giving five stars is that it seems to bow downward in the middle too much when weight is put on the middle. I would like to see at least the smallest upward arch to go along with the one machined into one half. But that's just me. I works just fine.

customer_reviews.author: John Vargo

customer_reviews.title: great price on extra long folding dirt bike ramp
customer_reviews.text: Solid and light for size. I use two set slightly apart from each other so I can walk up with my dirt bike since I am short and my truck tailgate is somewhat high.
customer_reviews.author: K.M.

product_meta.title: Titan Ramps 10' Long Folding Aluminum Arch ATV Ramps 1200 lb Capacity Light Weight Easy to Transport Dirt Bike Set of 2
product_meta.description:
Style:Set of 2 RampsThe Titan 10 ft ramps are the ultimate solution when loading your ATV and other 4 wheeled items into a tall truck or high trailer. The lightweight folding design makes storage and portability a breeze.

Features:
- Weight: 45 lbs
- Size: 120" x 11.25" x 6" (each)
- Folds: 60" x 11.25" x 6" (each)
- Material: Aluminum

Specifications:
- Capacity: 1,200 lbs distributed weight (per pair), 600 lbs each ramp
- Arched design for better clearance
- Serrated crossbars allow for great traction
- Safety straps included
- No assembly required
feature_bullets: Capacity: 1,200 lbs distributed weight (per pair) - Arched design for better clearance
Serrated crossbars allow for great traction - Safety straps included
No assembly required - Not intended for use with Golf Carts
